context: Some of the papers described their effectiveness in the process of focusing analytes before introducing the sample onto the head of the chromatographic column. The main aim of this study was to compare the characteristics of denudation traps prepared of segments of different types of capillary chromatographic columns. The research was done employing the method of equilibrium sorption, and determining the values of the partition coefficient of the analytes between the gaseous and the stationary phase (in the denuder). Chemicals and materials The reagents utilized in the experiments (benzene, toluene, ethylbenzene, o-xylene, chlorobenzene) are classified as chromatographic standards and were purchased from Polish Chemical Reagents (Gliwice, Poland). Segments (12 cm) of different types of capillary columns available on the market were employed as the denudation traps. More specific information is presented in Table 1 . The sorption trap used for calibrating the system was produced using a glass tube 105×4 mm (length×I.D.) filled with beds of solid sorbents: Tenax TA (100 mg, 35–60 mesh) purchased from Alltech (Lancashire, UK) and Carbotrap (50 mg, 20–40 mesh) purchased from Supelco (Bellefonte, USA).

llm_generation.summary: In this context, chlorobenzene is mentioned as one of the chemicals used as a chromatographic standard in experiments involving denudation traps and equilibrium sorption methods. It is grouped with other volatile organic compounds like benzene, toluene, and ethylbenzene, indicating its role as a chemical analyte in chromatographic processes. However, there is no detailed discussion of its specific properties or interactions beyond its classification as a chemical standard.
